title: catool: Walkthrough
text: vignette demonstrates use catool R package calculate overload compensation instructors based institutional course schedules compensation policies. package supports individual instructor analysis full-schedule summaries, applying proration eligibility rules based enrollment credit hours.

title: catool: Walkthrough
code: # Replace with your actual file path or upload method # Example fallback data (for build safety) schedule <- data.frame(   INSTRUCTOR = c("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", "Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", "Smith, John"),   ENRLD = c(12, 7, 4),   HRS = c(3, 3, 3),   stringsAsFactors = FALSE )

what: ğŸ‘¤ Get Schedule for One Instructor
title: catool: Walkthrough
code: get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", schedule) ##                INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS ## 1 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3 ## 2 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3

what: ğŸ’µ Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor
title: catool: Walkthrough
code: IS <- get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", schedule) ol_comp(IS)  # Uses default institutional policy ##                INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS Overload Pay by Course ## 1 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3                      0 ## 2 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3                      0 ## 3                                                          ## 4                                                          ## 5                                                          ##                      Summary Total Compensation (USD) ## 1                                                     ## 2                                                     ## 3 Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS:                        0 ## 4              OVERLOAD PAY:                       $0 ## 5                      NOTE: # Custom policy example ol_comp(IS, L = 4, U = 8, reg_load = 9, rate_per_cr = 5000 / 3) ##                INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS Overload Pay by Course ## 1 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3                      0 ## 2 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3                      0 ## 3                                                          ## 4                                                          ## 5                                                          ##                     Summary Total Compensation (USD) ## 1                                                    ## 2                                                    ## 3 Over 9 QUALIFIED CR. HRS:                        0 ## 4             OVERLOAD PAY:                       $0 ## 5                     NOTE:

what: ğŸ‘¥ List Unique Instructors in the Schedule
title: catool: Walkthrough
code: get_unique_instructors(schedule) ##                INSTRUCTOR ## 1 Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha ## 2             Smith, John

title: catool: Walkthrough
code: ol_comp_byindex(1, schedule_df = schedule) ##               INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS Overload Pay by Course ##                                                           ##  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3                      0 ##  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3                      0 ##                                                           ##                                                           ##                                                           ##                              Summary Total Compensation (USD) ##  INSTRUCTOR: Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha                          ##                                                               ##                                                               ##           Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS:                        0 ##                        OVERLOAD PAY:                       $0 ##                                NOTE: ol_comp_byindex(1, schedule_df = schedule, L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500 / 3, reg_load = 12) ##               INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS Overload Pay by Course ##                                                           ##  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3                      0 ##  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3                      0 ##                                                           ##                                                           ##                                                           ##                              Summary Total Compensation (USD) ##  INSTRUCTOR: Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha                          ##                                                               ##                                                               ##           Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS:                        0 ##                        OVERLOAD PAY:                       $0 ##                                NOTE:

HRS: 0 ## 5           Overload Pay Rate: $833.33 ## 6      Total Overload Compensation: $0 ## 7                                      ## 8                                      ## 9                                      ## 10                                     ## 11                                     ## 12             INSTRUCTOR: Smith, John ## 13        Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS: 0 ## 14          Overload Pay Rate: $833.33 ## 15     Total Overload Compensation: $0 ## 16                                     ## 17                                     ## 18                                     ## 19 ol_comp_summary(schedule, L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500 / 3, reg_load = 12) ##                 INSTRUCTOR ENRLD HRS QUALIFIED_CR ROW_AMOUNT  TYPE ## 1  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha    12   3            0          0       ## 2  Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha     7   3            0          0       ## 3                                                          0 TOTAL ## 4                                                                  ## 5                                                                  ## 6                                                                  ## 7                                                                  ## 8                                                                  ## 9                                                                  ## 10                                                                 ## 11             Smith, John     4   3            0          0       ## 12                                                         0 TOTAL ## 13                                                                 ## 14                                                                 ## 15                                                                 ## 16                                                                 ## 17                                                                 ## 18                                                                 ## 19                                                                 ##                                SUMMARY ## 1                                      ## 2                                      ## 3  INSTRUCTOR: Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha ## 4         Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS: 0 ## 5           Overload Pay Rate: $833.33 ## 6      Total Overload Compensation: $0 ## 7                                      ## 8                                      ## 9                                      ## 10                                     ## 11                                     ## 12             INSTRUCTOR: Smith, John ## 13        Over 12 QUALIFIED CR. HRS: 0 ## 14          Overload Pay Rate: $833.33 ## 15     Total Overload Compensation: $0 ## 16                                     ## 17                                     ## 18                                     ## 19

title: catool: Walkthrough
text: catool package determines overload compensation using institutional rules based : Enrollment (ENRLD) Credit hours (HRS) Regular teaching load (reg_load) Per-credit compensation rate (rate_per_cr)

title: catool: Walkthrough
text: Default Proration Range: Lower Bound (L) = 4 Upper Bound (U) = 9 Courses ENRLD < L â†’ pay Courses L â‰¤ ENRLD â‰¤ U â†’ Prorated Courses ENRLD > U â†’ Full pay Regular Load (reg_load): credit hours beyond eligible overload compensation (default = 12 credit hours). Rate per Credit Hour (rate_per_cr): Default 2500 / 3 (â‰ˆ 833.33), adjustable reflect institutionâ€™s policy.

title: catool: Walkthrough
text: thresholds pay rates user-adjustable via function arguments. Output returned tidy, human-readable tibble, ready reporting export.

title: catool: Walkthrough
text: questions feedback, contact Dawit Aberra aberrad@fvsu.edu.

title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough
text: vignette demonstrates use coat R package calculate overload compensation instructors based institutional course schedules compensation policies. package supports individual instructor analysis full-schedule summaries, applying proration eligibility rules based enrollment credit hours.

title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough
code: schedule <- read.csv("data-raw/schedule.csv")

what: ğŸ‘¤ Get Schedule for One Instructor

code: get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", schedule)

what: ğŸ’µ Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor
title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough

title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough
text: COAT package determines overload compensation using institutional rules based : Enrollment (ENRLD) Credit hours (HRS) Regular teaching load (reg_load) Per-credit compensation rate (rate_per_cr)

title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough
text: Default Proration Range: Lower Bound (L) = 4 Upper Bound (U) = 9 Courses ENRLD < L â†’ pay Courses L â‰¤ ENRLD â‰¤ U â†’ Prorated Courses ENRLD > U â†’ Full pay Regular Load (reg_load): credit hours beyond eligible overload compensation (default = 12 credit hours). Rate per Credit Hour (rate_per_cr): Default 2500 / 3 (â‰ˆ 833.33), adjustable reflect institutionâ€™s policy.

title: Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough
text: thresholds pay rates user-adjustable via function arguments. Output returned tidy, human-readable tibble, ready reporting export.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dawit Aberra. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aberra D (2025). catool: Compensation Analysis Tool Faculty Overload Pay. R package version 1.0.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {catool: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay},   author = {Dawit Aberra},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
text: catool (Compensation Analysis Tool) R package calculates fair transparent overload pay college instructors. processes course schedule data, identifies overload credit hours, applies enrollment-based proration logic compute compensation aligned institutional policies.

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
text: Filters qualified credit hours enrollment Computes prorated overload compensation per course Summarizes instructor-level pay Batch-processes full schedules Filters subject, instructor, division Outputs clean, export-ready summary tables

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
code: # Install directly from GitHub # install.packages("remotes")  # Only if not installed remotes::install_github("dawit3000/catool")

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
code: library(catool) schedule <- read.csv("data-raw/schedule.csv")  # One instructor ol_comp(get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock", schedule))  # With custom policy ol_comp(get_instructor_schedule("Smith", schedule),         L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500 / 3, reg_load = 12)  # Full summary ol_comp_summary(schedule)

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
code: get_division_schedule("Business Administration", schedule) get_subject_schedule("^MATH|^STAT", schedule) filter_schedule(schedule, division = "Nursing", instructor_pattern = "lee")

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
text: course schedule must contain columns:

title: Compensation Analysis Tool for Faculty Overload Pay
text: package returns tidy tibble : Overload pay per course Qualified credit hours Summary block total compensation Labels formatting readability

what: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
title: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
text: Applies one filters course schedule: instructor name (regex), subject code (regex), /academic division. Matching case-insensitive filters optional.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
code: filter_schedule(   schedule,   division = NULL,   subject_pattern = NULL,   instructor_pattern = NULL )

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
text: schedule data frame containing course schedule INSTRUCTOR SUBJ columns. division Optional character string naming division (must match known values). subject_pattern Optional regex pattern filtering subject codes (e.g., "CSCI", "^MATH"). instructor_pattern Optional regex pattern instructor name (e.g., "Smith", "^Jones").

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
text: filtered course schedule data frame.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division, Subject, and/or Instructor â€” filter_schedule
code: schedule <- data.frame(INSTRUCTOR = c("Lee", "Smith"),                        SUBJ = c("MATH", "NURS"),                        stringsAsFactors = FALSE) filter_schedule(schedule, division = "Nursing") #>   INSTRUCTOR SUBJ #> 1      Smith NURS filter_schedule(schedule, subject_pattern = "^MATH|^STAT") #>   INSTRUCTOR SUBJ #> 1        Lee MATH filter_schedule(schedule, instructor_pattern = "smith") #>   INSTRUCTOR SUBJ #> 1      Smith NURS filter_schedule(schedule, division = "Business Administration", instructor_pattern = "Lee") #> Warning: No courses found for division: 'Business Administration' #> Warning: No records found after applying filters. #> [1] INSTRUCTOR SUBJ       #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)

what: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
title: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
text: Returns subset schedule matching named academic division. function maps division names associated subject codes filters accordingly.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
code: get_division_schedule(division_name, schedule)

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
text: division_name character string naming division (must match one known values). schedule data frame containing course schedule data SUBJ column.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
text: filtered data frame containing courses specified division.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Division â€” get_division_schedule
code: schedule <- data.frame(SUBJ = c("MATH", "NURS", "BIOL")) get_division_schedule("Natural and Computational Sciences", schedule) #>   SUBJ #> 1 MATH #> 2 BIOL get_division_schedule("Nursing", schedule) #>   SUBJ #> 1 NURS

what: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
title: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
text: Returns subset course schedule containing courses taught specified instructor. Matching case-insensitive supports regular expressions, allowing flexible partial pattern-based matching. match found, warning issued empty data frame returned.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
code: get_instructor_schedule(instructor_name, schedule_df = schedule)

title: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
text: instructor_name character string (regular expression) used match values INSTRUCTOR column. schedule_df data frame containing course schedule data INSTRUCTOR column. Defaults schedule specified.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
text: data frame courses assigned instructors matching given pattern.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Instructor (Regex-Friendly, Case-Insensitive) â€” get_instructor_schedule
code: get_instructor_schedule("smith", schedule_df = schedule)  # partial match #>   P.of.T SUBJ NUMB SECT   CRN                       TITLE NOTES HRS ENRLD #> 1      1 CSCI 4999    1 49388 SPECIAL TOPICS IN CSCI/CSIS         3    12 #>   MAXENRL       TIMES DAYS                       LOCATION      INSTRUCTOR #> 1      15 11:00-12:15  T R 0219 COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY/MATHE Smith, Courtney #>        CAMPUS #> 1 Main Campus get_instructor_schedule("^Smith,", schedule_df = schedule)  # regex: starts with Smith #>   P.of.T SUBJ NUMB SECT   CRN                       TITLE NOTES HRS ENRLD #> 1      1 CSCI 4999    1 49388 SPECIAL TOPICS IN CSCI/CSIS         3    12 #>   MAXENRL       TIMES DAYS                       LOCATION      INSTRUCTOR #> 1      15 11:00-12:15  T R 0219 COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY/MATHE Smith, Courtney #>        CAMPUS #> 1 Main Campus get_instructor_schedule("Robinson|Smith", schedule_df = schedule)  # regex: matches either #>   P.of.T SUBJ NUMB SECT   CRN                       TITLE NOTES HRS ENRLD #> 1      1 CSCI 4999    1 49388 SPECIAL TOPICS IN CSCI/CSIS         3    12 #>   MAXENRL       TIMES DAYS                       LOCATION      INSTRUCTOR #> 1      15 11:00-12:15  T R 0219 COMPUTER TECHNOLOGY/MATHE Smith, Courtney #>        CAMPUS #> 1 Main Campus

what: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
title: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
text: Returns subset schedule SUBJ (subject code) column matches given pattern. Matching case-insensitive supports regular expressions.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
code: get_subject_schedule(subject_pattern, schedule)

title: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
text: subject_pattern character string regular expression match subject codes. schedule data frame containing course schedule data SUBJ column.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
text: filtered data frame containing matching subject codes.

title: Filter Course Schedule by Subject Code (Regex-Friendly) â€” get_subject_schedule
code: schedule <- data.frame(SUBJ = c("CSCI", "MATH", "STAT")) get_subject_schedule("CSCI", schedule) #>   SUBJ #> 1 CSCI get_subject_schedule("^MATH|^STAT", schedule) #>   SUBJ #> 1 MATH #> 2 STAT

what: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
title: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
text: Extracts sorted list unique, non-empty instructor names schedule data frame.

title: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
code: get_unique_instructors(schedule_df)

title: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
text: schedule_df data frame containing INSTRUCTOR column.

title: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
text: data frame one column: unique instructor names sorted alphabetically.

title: Get Unique Instructor Names â€” get_unique_instructors
code: # get_unique_instructors(schedule)

what: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor â€” ol_comp
title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor â€” ol_comp
text: Computes prorated overload pay qualified credit hours single instructor based course credit hours, enrollment, institutional overload rules.

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor â€” ol_comp
code: ol_comp(instructor_schedule, L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500/3, reg_load = 12)

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor â€” ol_comp
text: instructor_schedule data frame instructor's courses, columns ENRLD (enrollment) HRS (credit hours). L Lower enrollment threshold overload pay qualification (default = 4). U Upper limit proration; courses ENRLD > U get full-rate pay (default = 9). rate_per_cr Base overload pay per credit hour (default = 2500/3). reg_load Regular teaching load credit hours (default = 12).

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor â€” ol_comp
text: tibble original schedule, overload pay course, summary block.

what: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor (by Index) â€” ol_comp_byindex
title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor (by Index) â€” ol_comp_byindex
text: Retrieves instructor's name index schedule calculates overload compensation using ol_comp(). Returns clean, readable summary labeled header row, consistent Shiny App output.

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor (by Index) â€” ol_comp_byindex
code: ol_comp_byindex(   i,   schedule_df,   L = 4,   U = 9,   rate_per_cr = 2500/3,   reg_load = 12 )

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor (by Index) â€” ol_comp_byindex
text: Integer index instructor (returned get_unique_instructors()). schedule_df data frame full course schedule containing INSTRUCTOR column. L Lower enrollment threshold overload eligibility (inclusive). Default 4. U Upper enrollment limit proration (inclusive). Default 9. rate_per_cr Overload pay rate per credit hour. Default 2500/3. reg_load Regular teaching load credit hours. Default 12.

title: Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor (by Index) â€” ol_comp_byindex
text: Invisibly returns tibble instructorâ€™s overload compensation summary, formatted display.

what: Summarize Overload Compensation for One or All Instructors â€” ol_comp_summary
title: Summarize Overload Compensation for One or All Instructors â€” ol_comp_summary
text: Calculates overload compensation instructor (selected one) based institutional policies. Output includes course-level pay, qualified credit hours, readable summary section instructor.

title: Summarize Overload Compensation for One or All Instructors â€” ol_comp_summary
code: ol_comp_summary(   schedule_df,   instructor = NULL,   L = 4,   U = 9,   rate_per_cr = 2500/3,   reg_load = 12 )

title: Summarize Overload Compensation for One or All Instructors â€” ol_comp_summary
text: schedule_df data frame containing full course schedule, including INSTRUCTOR, HRS, ENRLD. instructor Optional string. provided, limits output instructor. Default NULL (). L Lower enrollment threshold overload eligibility (default = 4). U Upper limit proration. ENRLD > U gets full-rate pay (default = 9). rate_per_cr Pay rate per credit hour (default = 2500/3). reg_load Regular teaching load credit hours (default = 12).

title: Summarize Overload Compensation for One or All Instructors â€” ol_comp_summary
text: tibble combining course-level pay instructor summaries one instructors.

title: Sample Schedule Dataset â€” schedule
text: dataset represents sample class schedule used several institutions, slight variations variable names. Users must ensure key variablesâ€”HRS, ENRLD, INSTRUCTORâ€”properly named formatted functions package work correctly.

title: Sample Schedule Dataset â€” schedule
code: schedule

title: Sample Schedule Dataset â€” schedule
text: object class data.frame 665 rows 15 columns.

title: Sample Schedule Dataset â€” schedule
text: Included package data/schedule.rda

title: Sample Schedule Dataset â€” schedule
text: dataset containing instructor schedules overload analysis. dataset 665 rows 15 columns, including: HRS Credit hours course. ENRLD Number students enrolled course. INSTRUCTOR Name instructor teaching course (anonymized).

title: coat 1.0.0

title: coat 1.0.0
text: Calculates prorated overload pay per course. Applies institutional rules (e.g., enrollment thresholds regular load). Extracts one instructorâ€™s schedule full course dataset. Generate readable summaries instructor across full schedule. Returns alphabetically sorted list instructors.

title: coat 1.0.0
text: schedule: Sample dataset testing variables HRS, ENRLD, INSTRUCTOR.

title: coat 1.0.0
text: Standardized roxygen documentation exported functions Updated README, vignette, tests, DESCRIPTION Cleaned global variable declarations satisfy CRAN checks Passed R CMD check : 0 errors | 0 warnings | 3 notes (notes documented cran-comments.md) ğŸ’¡ See vignette complete walkthrough usage examples.
